meanings.definition: To fill with blood and cause to swell
meanings.sent1: After the mosquito bit me, my arm engorges and becomes red.
meanings.sent2: The balloon engorges with air until it pops.
meanings.sent3: The sponge engorges with water so much, it looks like a chubby fish.
meanings.sent4: Her cheeks engorge with embarrassment, turning as red as a ripe tomato.
meanings.sent5: The river engorges after heavy rain, overflowing its banks and flooding the fields.

meanings.sent1: The hungry dog engorges his food in seconds.
meanings.sent2: She engorges on popcorn while watching a movie.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon engorges on the garbage left outside, much to the annoyance of the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The greedy squirrel engorges on nuts, storing them away for the winter.
meanings.sent5: The child engorges on candy at the birthday party, feeling sick afterwards.
